tn.text: Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "If someone finds a person whom someone else has killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The dead person is lying in the field.

tn.ref: and it is not known who has attacked him
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and nobody knows who attacked him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: they must measure to the cities
tn.text: "they must measure the distance to the cities"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "him whom someone has killed" or "the dead body" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"has not worn a yoke"
This is an idiom for water that is moving. AT: "a stream" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: a valley that has been neither plowed nor sown
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "a valley where nobody has plowed the ground or planted seeds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.
"must come to the valley"

tn.ref: for them Yahweh your God has chosen to serve him
tn.text: "because the priests are the ones whom Yahweh your God has chosen to serve him"
Moses speaks to the Israelites as if he were speaking to one man, so the word "your" is singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"to bless the people of Israel"
Here the metonym "in the name of" refers to Yahweh and his authority. AT: "as one who says and does what Yahweh himself would say and do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"listen to what the priests say"

tn.ref: for their word will be the verdict
tn.text: Here the metonym "their word" refers to what the priests say. AT: "because whatever the priests say, that will be the decision" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: in every dispute and case of assault
tn.text: "every time people are in the court of law because they disagree with one another or somebody hurts another person"
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: the heifer whose neck was broken
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the heifer whose neck the priests broke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: and they must answer to the case
tn.text: "and they must testify to Yahweh about this case"

tn.ref: Our hands have not shed this blood
tn.text: Here "hands" are a synecdoche for the whole person and "shed this blood" is a metonym for killing an innocent person. AT: "We did not kill this innocent person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: neither have our eyes seen it
tn.text: Here "eyes" refers to the whole person. AT: "and we did not see anyone kill this person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

Moses continues to tell the elders what they should say when they wash their hands over the heifer. He speaks to them as if he were speaking to one man, so the words "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
Yahweh rescuing the people of Israel from being slaves in Egypt is spoken of as if Yahweh paid money to redeem his people from slavery. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: and do not put guilt for innocent bloodshed in the midst of your people Israel
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "and do not treat your people Israel as if they are guilty of killing an innocent person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Then the bloodshed will be forgiven them
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Then Yahweh will forgive his people Israel for the death of an innocent person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: you will put away the innocent blood from your midst
tn.text: "you will not be guilty any more of killing an innocent person"

tn.ref: what is right in the eyes of Yahweh
tn.text: The words "in the eyes of Yahweh" are a metonym for "what Yahweh thinks is right." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel as if he were speaking to one man, so the words "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"you who are soldiers go out" (UDB)

tn.ref: you have a desire for her
tn.text: Use a polite phrase for "you want to sleep with her."

tn.ref: wish to take her for yourself as a wife
tn.text: "want to marry her"
"she will shave the hair off of her head"
"cut her fingernails"
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel as if he were speaking to one man, so the words "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: she will take off the clothes she was wearing
tn.text: She will do this after the man brings her to his house and when she shaves her head and cuts her fingernails and toenails as mentioned in [[:en:bible:notes:deu:21:10|21:12]]. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "she will take off the clothes of her people and put on Israelite clothes" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "when you took her captive" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"an entire month" or "a whole month"

tn.ref: But if you take no delight in her
tn.text: You may need to make explicit that the man sleeps with the woman. AT: "But if you sleep with her and then decide that you do not want her as your wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: let her go where she wishes
tn.text: "let her go wherever she wants to go"
"because you shamed her by sleeping with her and then sending her away"
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: and one is loved and the other is hated
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: Possible meanings are 1) "and the man loves one of his wives and he hates the other wife" or 2) "and the man loves one wife more than he loves the other wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: and they have both borne him children
tn.text: "and both wives have had children with him"

tn.ref: if the firstborn son is of her that is hated
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "if the firstborn son belongs to the wife whom the man hates" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: then on the day that the man
tn.text: "when the man"

tn.ref: the man causes his sons to inherit what he possesses
tn.text: "the man gives his possessions to his sons as an inheritance"

tn.ref: he may not make the son of the beloved wife the firstborn before the son of the hated wife
tn.text: "he may not treat the son of the beloved wife as if he were the firstborn instead of the son of the hated wife"
"twice as much"

tn.ref: that son is the beginning of his strength
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "that son is the one who shows that the man can become the father of sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: who will not obey the voice of his father or the voice of his mother
tn.text: Here "voice" is a metonym for what a person says. AT: "who will not obey what his father or mother say" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"they punish him for his wrongdoing" or "they train and instruct him"

tn.ref: must lay hold on him and bring him out
tn.text: "must force him to come out"
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel as if they were one man, so all instances of "you" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
"Our son"

tn.ref: he will not obey our voice
tn.text: Here "voice" is a metonym for what a person says or a synecdoche for the whole person. AT: "he will not do what we tell him to do" or "he will not obey us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
a person who eats and drinks too much
a person who drinks too much alcohol and gets drunk often

tn.ref: stone him to death with stones
tn.text: "throw stones at him until he dies"

tn.ref: you will remove the evil from among you
tn.text: The adjective "evil" can be translated as a noun phrase. AT: "you must remove from among the Israelites the person who does this evil thing" or "you must execute this evil person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_nominaladj]])
The word "Israel" is a metonym for the people of Israel. AT: "All the people of Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: will hear of it and fear
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "will hear about what happened to the son and be afraid that the people will punish them also" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
Moses continues speaking to the people of Israel as if he were speaking to one man, so the words "you" and "your" are singular. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])

tn.ref: If a man has committed a sin worthy of death
tn.text: "If a man has done something so bad that you need to punish him by killing him"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "you execute him" or "you kill him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: and you hang him on a tree
tn.text: Possible meanings are 1) "and after he has died you hang him on a tree" or 2) "and you kill him by hanging him on a wooden post"
"bury him on the same day as when you execute him"

tn.ref: for whoever is hanged is cursed by God
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: Possible meanings are 1) "because God curses everyone whom people hang on trees" and 2) "people hang on trees those whom God has cursed." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
by leaving something God has cursed hanging in the tree
